skill.name: peer-review
skill.description: Systematic peer review toolkit. Evaluate methodology, statistics, design, reproducibility, ethics, figure integrity, reporting standards, for manuscript and grant review across disciplines.
skill.summary: Systematic peer review toolkit. Evaluate methodology, statistics, design, reproducibility, ethics, f...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. Contains references to external skills and tools but no direct implementations.

content.value_statement: Peer review of scientific manuscripts requires consistent methodology across disciplines. This skill provides structured frameworks for evaluating methodology, statistics, reproducibility, ethics, and reporting standards for comprehensive manuscript and grant assessment.
actual_capabilities: Evaluate scientific methodology and experimental design rigor
Assess statistical methods, sample sizes, and data analysis validity
Check reproducibility, data availability, and code sharing practices
Review figure quality, integrity, and appropriate visualization
Verify compliance with reporting standards (CONSORT, PRISMA, ARRIVE)
Evaluate ethical considerations and research integrity concerns
limitations: Does not access external databases or verify citations automatically
Cannot examine actual data files or raw experimental results
Does not execute or validate statistical analyses directly
Cannot access published literature for independent verification

use_cases.title: Manuscript evaluation
use_cases.description: Conduct comprehensive peer review of research manuscripts with systematic methodology and statistical assessment.

use_cases.title: Grant proposal assessment
use_cases.description: Evaluate grant proposals for methodological rigor, feasibility, and scientific significance across disciplines.

use_cases.title: Pre-submission review
use_cases.description: Self-assess manuscripts before journal submission to identify and address potential reviewer concerns proactively.

prompt_templates.title: Basic manuscript review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this scientific manuscript using the peer-review skill. Evaluate the methodology, statistical analysis, reproducibility, and reporting standards compliance. Provide a structured review with major comments, minor comments, and an overall recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Grant evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this grant proposal using the peer-review skill. Assess the research design, methodology rigor, feasibility, and scientific significance. Provide detailed feedback on strengths, weaknesses, and specific concerns.

prompt_templates.title: Statistical review focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a focused statistical review of this manuscript using the peer-review skill. Evaluate statistical methods, sample size justification, assumption checking, multiple testing correction, and appropriate effect size reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Reproducibility check
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess the reproducibility of this research using the peer-review skill. Review data availability, code sharing, methodological detail, and compliance with relevant reporting guidelines. Identify specific gaps that would prevent independent replication.

output_examples.input: Review this research manuscript on clinical trial outcomes
output: Summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluates a new intervention for chronic condition management. The study addresses an important clinical question with a well-designed primary outcome.
Major concerns: Sample size calculation lacks justification for effect size assumptions. Statistical methods appropriate but multiple testing correction not applied for secondary outcomes.
Strengths: Rigorous randomization and blinding procedures. CONSORT guidelines followed. Clear methods description.
Recommendations: Apply FDR correction for secondary outcomes. Provide post-hoc power analysis details. Clarify exclusion criteria.
Overall recommendation: Major revisions required before publication.

best_practices: Provide specific, actionable feedback with concrete examples from the manuscript
Distinguish between major issues affecting validity and minor issues affecting clarity
Balance criticism with acknowledgment of manuscript strengths
anti_patterns: Making vague criticisms without specific line or page references
Requesting unnecessary experiments beyond the study scope
Using dismissive or condescending language regardless of manuscript quality

faq.question: Does this skill work for all scientific disciplines?
faq.answer: Yes. The framework covers core principles applicable across disciplines with discipline-specific reporting standards references.

faq.question: Can this skill review grant proposals?
faq.answer: Yes. The methodology assessment criteria apply directly to evaluating grant proposals for rigor and feasibility.

faq.question: Does the skill access external databases?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that provides evaluation frameworks but cannot verify citations or access external databases.

faq.question: Is statistical expertise required to use this skill?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides guidance on evaluating statistical methods at a conceptual level for general reviewers.

faq.question: Can this skill generate the actual review letter?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides structured templates and frameworks for generating comprehensive review reports.

faq.question: How does this compare to other review tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides comprehensive human-guided evaluation frameworks rather than automated checklists or citation checkers.
